entries.title: Learning in Public: What Happens When You Build with AI Alongside Your Users
entries.excerpt: There is something both humbling and clarifying about sharing your learning as it happens. When I started using AI tools in my UX practice, I made a deliberate choice to document the process — not the polished outcome, but the messy, iterative middle.

entries.title: Accessibility Beyond Compliance: Why the Minimum Is Never Enough
entries.excerpt: WCAG tells us what we must do. But the lived experience of disabled people tells us what we should do. These are often the same thing — and sometimes they are not, which is where the interesting work begins.

entries.title: Ethical AI in Government Digital Services: Questions Worth Sitting With
entries.excerpt: As AI capabilities are introduced into services that millions of New Zealanders depend on — from housing to justice to welfare — the questions we ask at the design stage carry real consequences. This is a reflection on where I think we are, and where we need to go.

entries.title: Information Architecture: The Invisible Work That Makes Everything Findable
entries.excerpt: Most people never think about how content is organised — until it isn't. Good information architecture is the quiet infrastructure of the web: the difference between a service people navigate confidently and one that loses people on step two.

entries.title: Five Things the IxDF Conversation Design Masterclass Taught Me About AI Interfaces
entries.excerpt: Conversational AI is having a moment, but many of the patterns people are building haven't been tested against the mental models of real users. Here are five ideas from the Conversation Design Masterclass that I keep returning to.

entries.title: Te Tiriti o Waitangi and Digital Design: Whose Values Are Embedded in the Interface?
entries.excerpt: Every design decision encodes values. The question is which values — and whose. Engaging honestly with Te Tiriti as a framework for digital services in Aotearoa means asking harder questions than most design processes are set up to handle.
